title: Delta Air Line sues CrowdStrike over 'catastrophic' software update that prompted mass flight cancellations
content: Delta is suing cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike after a July outage caused by a faulty software update led to massive flight cancellations and $500 million in losses. The lawsuit claims CrowdStrike's untested update disrupted 8.5 million PCs globally, severely impacting Delta's operations. CrowdStrike denies liability, citing Delta's outdated IT infrastructure.
summary: Delta is suing cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike after a July outage caused by a faulty software update led to massive flight cancellations and $500 million in losses. The lawsuit claims CrowdStrike's untested update disrupted 8.5 million PCs globally, severely impacting Delta's operations. CrowdStrike denies liability, citing Delta's outdated IT infrastructure.

Zelensky says North Korean troops poised to join war
content: North Korean troops are set to be deployed by Russia in Ukraine this weekend, escalating the conflict and raising global tensions. Ukrainian intelligence reports about 12,000 North Korean soldiers, including officers and generals, being prepared for combat, with initial deployments likely in the Kursk region.
summary: North Korean troops are set to be deployed by Russia in Ukraine this weekend, escalating the conflict and raising global tensions. Ukrainian intelligence reports about 12,000 North Korean soldiers, including officers and generals, being prepared for combat, with initial deployments likely in the Kursk region.

title: Army releases redacted police report on altercation during controversial Trump's Arlington cemetery visit
content: The US Army released a heavily redacted report on a Trump campaign staffer allegedly pushing a cemetery employee at Arlington National Cemetery. The incident involved filming restrictions during Trump's visit. The police report was made public following a lawsuit by American Oversight, despite ongoing investigations.
summary: The US Army released a heavily redacted report on a Trump campaign staffer allegedly pushing a cemetery employee at Arlington National Cemetery. The incident involved filming restrictions during Trump's visit. The police report was made public following a lawsuit by American Oversight, despite ongoing investigations.

title: Democrats burn through cash while outraising Republicans in final weeks of fight for the Senate
content: Democratic candidates significantly outspent their Republican rivals in the first half of October in key Senate races across states like Ohio, Montana, and Michigan. This financial advantage allowed Democrats to allocate substantial resources to defend multiple states, while Republicans relied heavily on outside groups for support.
summary: Democratic candidates significantly outspent their Republican rivals in the first half of October in key Senate races across states like Ohio, Montana, and Michigan. This financial advantage allowed Democrats to allocate substantial resources to defend multiple states, while Republicans relied heavily on outside groups for support.

title: Leonardo DiCaprio endorses Kamala Harris: 'We need a bold step forward ...'
'Disgusting': Trump campaign slams Hillary Clinton for 'reenacting Nazi rally' attack
Chinese hackers targeted Trump, JD Vance's phones: Report
content: "The type of information on phones used by a presidential candidate and his running mate could be a gold mine for an intelligence agency: Who they called and texted, how often they communicated with certain people, and how long they talked to those people could be highly valuable to an adversary like China. That sort of communications data could be even more useful if hackers could observe it in real time," the NYT report said.
summary: "The type of information on phones used by a presidential candidate and his running mate could be a gold mine for an intelligence agency: Who they called and texted, how often they communicated with certain people, and how long they talked to those people could be highly valuable to an adversary like China. That sort of communications data could be even more useful if hackers could observe it in real time," the NYT report said.

title: Whatever Barron recommended broke the internet, says Trump campaign adviser on podcast choice
content: ​“I got to tell you, hats off to the young man (Barron Trump). Every single recommendation he’s had has turned out to be absolute ratings gold that’s broke the internet," Jason Miller said as Trump is all set to appear with Joe Rogan's podcast to be recorded today. Rogan's podcast is one of the most popular in the US with 14 million followers on the streaming platform Spotify. This will be Donald Trump's first appearance on Joe Rogan's podcast.
summary: ​“I got to tell you, hats off to the young man (Barron Trump). Every single recommendation he’s had has turned out to be absolute ratings gold that’s broke the internet," Jason Miller said as Trump is all set to appear with Joe Rogan's podcast to be recorded today. Rogan's podcast is one of the most popular in the US with 14 million followers on the streaming platform Spotify. This will be Donald Trump's first appearance on Joe Rogan's podcast.

title: 'What the f**k to do with them?': Russian soldiers hostile to arriving North Korean soldiers, intercepts show
content: Russian soldiers are apprehensive about the arrival of North Korean troops, criticizing the command structure and support logistics. Ukraine's Defense Intelligence intercepted communications revealing these concerns. North Korean troops have been spotted in Russia's Kursk region, and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy condemned this escalation, urging international pressure against Moscow and Pyongyang.
summary: Russian soldiers are apprehensive about the arrival of North Korean troops, criticizing the command structure and support logistics. Ukraine's Defense Intelligence intercepted communications revealing these concerns. North Korean troops have been spotted in Russia's Kursk region, and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy condemned this escalation, urging international pressure against Moscow and Pyongyang.

title: Washington Post won't endorse Trump or Harris this election -- first time in 36 years
content: ​Earlier it was reported that the paper was dragging its feet on the decision as owner Jeff Bezos is not willing to endorse Kamala Harris alienating Donald Trump. The decision to not endorse anyone confirms the dithering. A New York Post report earlier said that the editorial board of the Washington Post wrote its endorsement of Kamala Harris but received no approval from Bezos or Will Lewis to publish it.
summary: ​Earlier it was reported that the paper was dragging its feet on the decision as owner Jeff Bezos is not willing to endorse Kamala Harris alienating Donald Trump. The decision to not endorse anyone confirms the dithering. A New York Post report earlier said that the editorial board of the Washington Post wrote its endorsement of Kamala Harris but received no approval from Bezos or Will Lewis to publish it.

title: Watch: Donald Trump adds golf swing to his iconic dance moves, social media reacts
content: Former US President Donald Trump added a golf swing to his signature dance moves at a rally, sparking online reactions. Despite Village People's earlier objections to Trump's usage of their song "YMCA," frontman Victor Willis has decided to permit its use until the 2024 campaign's end.
summary: Former US President Donald Trump added a golf swing to his signature dance moves at a rally, sparking online reactions. Despite Village People's earlier objections to Trump's usage of their song "YMCA," frontman Victor Willis has decided to permit its use until the 2024 campaign's end.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy reveals Trump's rare human trait, says 'couldn't be more impressed'
content: JD Vance said Donald Trump's energy level is off the charts and it's crazy how little Donald Trump sleeps. "I sleep less than most people. Not saying it's good or bad, just the way I'm constituted. Trump sleeps less than I do, does as many (or more) events, and will still randomly call me to check on my family. It's the craziest thing," Vance said.
summary: JD Vance said Donald Trump's energy level is off the charts and it's crazy how little Donald Trump sleeps. "I sleep less than most people. Not saying it's good or bad, just the way I'm constituted. Trump sleeps less than I do, does as many (or more) events, and will still randomly call me to check on my family. It's the craziest thing," Vance said.

title: Ukraine's bid to add Russia to FATF's 'black list' fails as India, China reject move
content: Ukraine's bid to blacklist Russia over high-risk money laundering was rejected by India, China, Saudi Arabia, and South Africa during the FATF discussions in Paris. Brazil also opposed the proposal, which led to a delay for further evidence gathering. Russia's FATF membership remains suspended.
summary: Ukraine's bid to blacklist Russia over high-risk money laundering was rejected by India, China, Saudi Arabia, and South Africa during the FATF discussions in Paris. Brazil also opposed the proposal, which led to a delay for further evidence gathering. Russia's FATF membership remains suspended.
